Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization

Class Pose

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.localization.Pose
public class Pose extends Object
This is the Pose class. It defines poses in 2D space, like the Pose2D class in Road Runner except in the Pedro Pathing code so I don't have to import the Road Runner library. A Pose consists of two coordinates defining a position and a third value for the heading, so basically just defining any position and orientation the robot can be at, unless your robot can fly for whatever reason.

    Pose(double setX, double setY, double setHeading)
    This creates a new Pose from a x, y, and heading inputs.

  • Constructor Details

    • Pose

      public Pose(double setX, double setY, double setHeading)
      This creates a new Pose from a x, y, and heading inputs.
      Parameters:
      setX - the initial x value
      setY - the initial y value
      setHeading - the initial heading value

    • Pose

      public Pose(double setX, double setY)
      This creates a new Pose from x and y inputs. The heading is set to 0.
      Parameters:
      setX - the initial x value
      setY - the initial y value

    • Pose

      public Pose()
      This creates a new Pose with no inputs and 0 for all values.

    • getVector

      public Vector getVector()
      This returns the Pose as a Vector. Naturally, the heading data in the Pose cannot be included in the Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the Pose as a Vector

    • getHeadingVector

      public Vector getHeadingVector()
      This returns a new Vector with magnitude 1 pointing in the direction of the heading.
      Returns:
      returns a unit Vector in the direction of the heading

    • add

      public void add(Pose pose)
      This adds all the values of an input Pose to this Pose. The input Pose's data will not be changed.
      Parameters:
      pose - the input Pose

      public void scalarDivide(double scalar)
      This divides all the values of this Pose by a scalar.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar

    • flipSigns

      public void flipSigns()
      This flips the signs of all values in this Pose by multiplying them by -1. Heading values are still normalized to be between 0 and 2 * pi in value.

    • roughlyEquals

      public boolean roughlyEquals(Pose pose, double accuracy)
      This returns if a Pose is within a specified accuracy of this Pose in terms of x position, y position, and heading.
      Parameters:
      pose - the input Pose to check
      accuracy - the specified accuracy necessary to return true
      Returns:
      returns if the input Pose is within the specified accuracy of this Pose

    • roughlyEquals

      public boolean roughlyEquals(Pose pose)
      This checks if the input Pose is within 0.0001 in all values to this Pose.
      Parameters:
      pose - the input Pose
      Returns:
      returns if the input Pose is within 0.0001 of this Pose

      public Pose copy()
      This creates a copy of this Pose that points to a new memory location.
      Returns:
      returns a deep copy of this Pose
